intro: Securinega multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered securinega, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its woody shrub form with opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it is known for its ability to thrive in moist, acidic soils. Securinega multiflora is also notable for its medicinal properties, having been used in traditional herbal remedies.
